title: Quick cover of Make it Tighter I did
content:
[url=http://velcrodan.sound-club.org/Velcro%20Dan%20-%20Commander%20Keen%205%20-%20Make%20It%20Tighter.mp3]mp3[/url]
[url=http://velcrodan.sound-club.org/Velcro%20Dan%20-%20Commander%20Keen%205%20-%20Make%20It%20Tighter.ogg]ogg vorbis[/url]

Was bored last night.

(Some of you MIGHT recognize my name -- I've been around ever since the InsideTheWeb days (I was the sound guy for Isis 2, among other things), but I spontaneously "left" about six years ago due to having better things to do)

title: Re: Quick cover of Make it Tighter I did
content:
Not bad at all - my only two criticisms are that it sounds quite muffly (like the treble has been turned all the way down) and it's not *that* different from the original tune (as compared to a lot of other Keen remixes that sound completely different, with a recognisable Keen melody woven into the song.)

Other than that though, it sounds great!

title: Re: Quick cover of Make it Tighter I did
content:
Haha, glad to see you! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

Anyways, sounds very nice!3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Quick cover of Make it Tighter I did
content:
Nice. I'm a sucker for video game music in any form, especially Keen music.________________
[img]http://img80.imageshack.us/img80/8498/missouriansf9.png[/img]

title: Re: Quick cover of Make it Tighter I did
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]and it's not *that* different from the original tune[hr][/quote]

That's the idea. I took pains to get the instruments to sound sort of similar, in fact.

[quote]Quote:[hr]sounds quite muffly[hr][/quote]

The treble's actually augmented a bit. You're still correct that it doesn't have much of a high component (other than the high hats and the resonant lead in parts).

[quote]Quote:[hr]Not a bad mix; why'd you come back?[hr][/quote]

I've been talking to a lot of the big names in game music from back when it was big, and Bobby Prince was one of them. Then that lead me to talking to Romero (he says he's got the source code and he's about to release it, by the way) and a few other people and my interest in old DOS games was renewed and now I am here.

EDIT: Incidentally, I am confused -- is the coincidence of your name and [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Gray]Richard "Levelord" Gray's[/url] accidental?

title: Re: Ah!
content:
Oh my heaven! That source code thing is about to come to reality! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] *tries to breath, in vain* [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-birthday.gif[/img]

EDIT: It's not coincidence, LL is his fan, as far as I can remember. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Seriously?
content:
Hold, HOLD ON people; we still don't know *what* source code he's releasing; this could be Dangerous Dave 1 for all we know. So lets just calm down and wait patiently. [I know I'm jiggling in my chair, do what I say, not what I do.]

Szevvy Forever!
And Spleen never!

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.jpg[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

Keen 4. That's the whole point.
